DOC.brief_summary: Children are typically inadequately prepared for the sexual abuse medical examination. Caregivers report lack of examination knowledge as a barrier to preparing their children. The purpose of this study was to determine if informational leaflets provided prior to the examination are helpful to caregivers in preparing their children.
DOC.brief_title: Preparing Caregivers for the Child Sexual Abuse Examination: Are Informational Leaflets Helpful?
DOC.criteria: consecutive caregivers accompanying children for scheduled sexual abuse medical examination Lack of consent Failure to complete study
DOC.keyword: Lack of Preparation for Abused Children during Medical Examination
